paper_keywords: The stable marriage with ties and incomplete lists
paper_abstract: The problem of finding a largest stable matching where preference lists may include ties and unacceptable partners (MAX SMTI) is known to be NP-hard. It cannot be approximated within 33/29 (> 1.1379) unless P=NP, and the current best approximation algorithm achieves the ratio of 1.5. MAX SMTI remains NP-hard even when preference lists of one side do not contain ties, and it cannot be approximated within 21/19 (> 1.1052) unless P=NP. However, even under this restriction, the best known approximation ratio is still 1.5. In this paper, we improve it to 25/17 (< 1.4706).
paper_title: A 25/17-Approximation Algorithm for the Stable Marriage Problem with One-Sided Ties
